Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド村
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado Village

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド村・宿屋
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado Village - Inn

Entry.JapaneseText: どんな手を使ったんだ、 クレア。
Entry.EnglishText: How the heck did you pull that off, Claire?

Entry.JapaneseText: ふふっ…… ナイショよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hehe... That's a secret.

Entry.JapaneseText: それより、 これからの事を考えなきゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: And besides, we need to think about where to go from here.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>さんのお母さんは 見つかったけど、聖獣の事は 何もわかってないものね。
Entry.EnglishText: We found <Hilda>'s mother, but we've yet to learn anything about a Sacred Beast.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、肝心のお母さんには 追い返されちゃったし……
Entry.EnglishText: Kinda hard to do that when the mother essential to all this just gave us the boot...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最初はいい感じだったのにな。 角がどうとか言ってたけど、 何かあるのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: And it seemed to be going so well at first, too. Then she went and said something about horns... What was all that about?

Entry.JapaneseText: 角……ナイラさんの角…… あるいは<Hilda>の……ううむ……
Entry.EnglishText: Horns... Was she referring to her own, or perhaps <Hilda>'s? Hmm...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうしてあの人は、 私のカードを破ったのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: What I want to know is why she destroyed my cards.

Entry.JapaneseText: もう一度、ナイラさんと 話をするしかなさそうだが……
Entry.EnglishText: Looks like we have no choice but to try talking to Nayla again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私も行くわ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I'll go.

Entry.JapaneseText: 痛みを恐れてたら、 欲しいものは手に入らないから。
Entry.EnglishText: Running away from what hurts won't get me what I want, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『宿用の寝間着』 寝る時に着る宿用の着物。 胸のところに宿の名前が刺しゅうされている。 きれいにたたまれているところから 宿屋の人柄もうかがわれる。 着るのがもったいないほど。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Inn Sleepwear - This is clothing that is worn when sleeping at the inn. The name of the inn is embroidered around the chest area. You can see the innkeeper's character based on how neatly it has been folded. It's almost a waste to ruin those folds by wearing it.
Entry.Notes: May need a proofread to write it in a way that sounds more natural.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『押し葉』 ぺしゃんこに潰された 葉っぱが飾ってある。 葉っぱの色はまだ青々としている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Pressed Leaf - A leaf that was flattened and pressed to put on display. The leaf is still green.
Entry.Notes: May need to be leaves if it's more than one.
